Wrapping StarTeam around PVCS

StarTeam projects can be wrapped around PVCS archives. To accomplish this, StarTeam reads the entire revision history and lock status for each PVCS file that it adds to the project.

During the wrapping process, if a PVCS archive has revisions with check-in dates that do not chronologically increase, StarTeam modifies these dates to make them chronological. It logs these changes in the pvcs-err.locale.log file in the repository folder.

Note: StarTeam revision labels are different from PVCS fixed/revision labels. In StarTeam, a revision label belongs only to the view in which it was created. If a file has a given revision label in one view, it does not keep that revision label as it branches in a new view. However, when StarTeam wraps PVCS, a file that branches in a new view still retains the revision labels it had in the parent view. This latter behavior is what PVCS users would expect.

To wrap a StarTeam project around a PVCS project, so that they are interoperable:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • Click the New Project button on the toolbar.

    • Select Project > New from the menu bar.

    • Drag the vcs.cfg file from Network Neighborhood or Explorer to an empty portion of the window to create the project.

    The New Project Wizard dialog opens.

  2. From the server list, do one of the following

    • Select the server configuration that will store the project. If you are not currently logged onto this server, the Log On dialog will request a log-on name and password. Enter this information, and click Next.

    • If the desired server configuration does not appear on the list, click Add Server to add access to it. See Adding a Server Configuration. Then select the new configuration.

  3. Click Next. The New Project Wizard: Project Name dialog opens.

  4. Enter the name of the new project in the Project Name text box.

  5. Enter a description of the project in the Project Description text box.

  6. Click Foreign Archives. The Select Foreign Archive dialog opens. If you are using drag-and-drop, go to step 9.

  7. Select the Create project from check box.

  8. Select the PVCS option button.

  9. In the Config file path text box, enter or browse for the database file path (by default, vcs.cfg).

  10. In the Password text box, type the PVCS password for the user currently logged onto StarTeam.

  11. Click OK.

  12. Click Next. The New Project Wizard: Working Folder dialog opens.

  13. In the Default working folder text box, enter or browse for the path to the working folder you want to use as the root working folder for your project.

  14. In the Archive root folder text box, enter or browse for the root path to the archive folders. In your PVCS .cfg file, this is usually the first path name in the VCSDIR directive.

    15. As StarTeam creates working folders for each archive folder, it replaces the archive root folder in each path in the VCSDIR directive with the path to the root working folder.

    If the following VCSDIR directive is in your .cfg file:

    VCSDIR = "c:\archives"; "c:\archives\pc"; "c:\archives\mac"; "c:\archives\unix"

    the following working folders will result: C:\work, C:\work\pc, C:\work\mac, and C:\work\unix.

  15. Click Finish to open the project. After the wrapping process, the PVCS files are displayed in the File list with Unknown status. You must update the status of these files on your workstation.

    16. If any problems occur with the wrapping process, an error message asks you to check the pvcs-err.locale.log file. If the problems in the pvcs-err.locale.log file are severe, you can delete this project and re-wrap the PVCS archives.

Warning: After the project is created but before the process is finished, the project becomes accessible; however, it should not be accessed until the process is complete.
